page.title: 16Religion and Education
page.content: The principle traditions of Western Christianity have churches in the area, the oldest being Church Kirk. In 642 when King Oswald marched south it is likely that he had a wooden sanctuary erected here. In June 1985, after a laps of many years, the parish had an outdoor procession involving 250 people. In 1812 in Clayton-le-Moors a Society of Methodists began. The two chapels on Barnes Square were demolished and in 1981 the old school was converted into a church. In 1886 a Roman Catholic parish was set up in Rishton. The Hermitage was used for worship until 1896 when the school was built. The church of St. Charles dates from 1938. As a result of this religious influence, most of the primary schools are church schools.
